div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE, THOMAS, EARLE OF EXCETER, ONE OF HIS MAIESTIES MOST Honorable Priuy Councell; All Grace and Happinesse.
div.p:
I Knew J could not bestow my thoughts better then vpon Gods owne Historie, so full of edification and delight: which I haue in such sort indeuoured to doe, that J shall giue occasion to my Reader of some Meditations, which perhaps hee would haue missed. Euery helpe in this kinde deserues to be precious. J present the first part to your Honour, wherein you shall see the World both made, and smothered againe: Man
in the glory of his Creation, and the shame of his fall: Paradise at once made and lost. The first Man killing his seede, the second his brother. Jf in these I shall giue light to the thoughts of any Reader, let him with mee giue the praise to him from whom that light shone forth to me. To whose grace and protection I humbly commend your Lordship: as

closer.signed: Your Honours vnfainedly deuoted in all obseruance and dutie, IOS. HALL.
